content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]*?)\n```"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Loop over all matches of the regular expression in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)
        # Get the content of the matched code block
        content = match.captures[1]

        # Remove the leading and trailing whitespace from the content
        clean_content = strip(content)

        # Append the clean content to the extracted code string
        extracted_code *= "\n" * clean_content
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match all ````julia` code blocks in the markdown document. It then iterates over each match, strips any leading and trailing whitespace from the content of the code block, and joins all the code blocks together with a newline. Finally, it returns the combined string of extracted Julia code.
